posts.content:
Sometimes it's worth checking out CISA's Vulnerability Summary, just to see what the cyber publications missed. For example in Monday's Vulnerability Summary for the Week of July 29, 2024, you'll see that D-Link, a Taiwanese networking/telecoms hardware company, has two vulnerabilities CVE-2024-41610 and CVE-2024-41611 with a CVSSv3.1 score of 9.8 critical and reads "contains hardcoded credentials in the Telnet service, enabling attackers to log in remotely to the Telnet service and perform arbitrary commands."

D-Link doesn't even list CVE IDs on their dedicated security advisories page.

And this is not the first time D-Link has been caught with hardcoded credentials:

  • 09 September 2017 by @campuscodi: Researcher Publishes Details on Unpatched D-Link Router Flaws
  • 02 July 2019 by @serghei: D-Link Settles FTC Lawsuit, Promises to Enhance Device Security
  • 16 July 2021: D-Link issues hotfix for hard-coded password router vulnerabilities
  • 06 April 2024: Over 92,000 exposed D-Link NAS devices have a backdoor account
    • 08 April 2024: Critical RCE bug in 92,000 D-Link NAS devices now exploited in attacks

At this rate, I wouldn't trust that a D-Link product doesn't have hardcoded credentials baked in. smh.

#Dlink #vulnerability #CVE_2024_41610 #CVE_2024_41611

CVE-2024-20443.description:
A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco ISE could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to conduct an XSS attack against a user of the interface.

This vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input by the web-based management interface of an affected system. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by injecting malicious code into specific pages of the interface. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary script code in the context of the affected interface or access sensitive, browser-based information. To exploit this vulnerability, the attacker must have at least a low-privileged account on an affected device.

CVE-2024-20454.description:
Multiple vulnerabilities in the web-based management interface of Cisco Small Business SPA300 Series IP Phones and Cisco Small Business SPA500 Series IP Phones could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the underlying operating system with root privileges.

These vulnerabilities exist because incoming HTTP packets are not properly checked for errors, which could result in a buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request to an affected device. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to overflow an internal buffer and execute arbitrary commands at the root privilege level.

posts.content:
Jenkins: Jenkins Security Advisory 2024-08-07

  • CVE-2024-43044 (vendor 9.0 critical) Arbitrary file read vulnerability through agent connections can lead to RCE
  • CVE-2024-43045 (vendor 5.4 medium) Missing permission check allows accessing other users' "My Views"

No mention of exploitation. Here's why you should care about CVE-2024-43044 and CVE-2024-4345: Jenkins, an open source automation server, has four vulnerabilities in CISA's Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog since 2022.

#CVE_2024_43044 #CVE_2024_43045 #Jenkins #vulnerability #CVE

posts.content:
Jenkins: Jenkins Security Advisory 2024-08-07

  • CVE-2024-43044 (vendor 9.0 critical) Arbitrary file read vulnerability through agent connections can lead to RCE
  • CVE-2024-43045 (vendor 5.4 medium) Missing permission check allows accessing other users' "My Views"

No mention of exploitation. Here's why you should care about CVE-2024-43044 and CVE-2024-4345: Jenkins, an open source automation server, has four vulnerabilities in CISA's Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog since 2022.

#CVE_2024_43044 #CVE_2024_43045 #Jenkins #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-43045.description:
Jenkins 2.470 and earlier, LTS 2.452.3 and earlier does not perform a permission check in an HTTP endpoint.

This allows attackers with Overall/Read permission to access other users' "My Views". Attackers with global View/Configure and View/Delete permissions are also able to change other users' "My Views".

Jenkins 2.471, LTS 2.452.4, LTS 2.462.1 restricts access to a user’s "My Views" to the owning user and administrators.

CVE-2024-4345.description: The Startklar Elementor Addons plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to arbitrary file uploads due to insufficient file type validation in the 'process' function in the 'startklarDropZoneUploadProcess' class in versions up to, and including, 1.7.13. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to upload arbitrary files on the affected site's server which may make remote code execution possible.

posts.content:
CISA: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds two CVEs to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-32113 (9.1 critical) Apache OFBiz Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-36971 (7.8 high) Android Kernel Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

EDIT: In case anyone is wondering why it says "Access Denied", I'm too quick for CISA, and they haven't officially published the blog post. It will be available sometime in the next few hours.

#CVE_2024_32113 #CVE_2024_36971 #eitw #activeexploitation #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #vulnerability #CVE #Apache #OFbiz #Android

posts.content:
@da_667 My takeaway is that CVE-2024-38856 is a patch-bypass of CVE-2024-36104, which is a path traversal. I had an issue with SonicWall calling it a zero-day, which implied that it was known to threat actors. No evidence given.

PoC diffing with https://github.com/Mr-xn/CVE-2024-32113

CVE-2024-32113.description:
Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal') vulnerability in Apache OFBiz.This issue affects Apache OFBiz: before 18.12.13.

Users are recommended to upgrade to version 18.12.13, which fixes the issue.

🚩 CVE-2024-34102 (CVSSv3 9.8) - this XML External Entity Injection in Magento can result in arbitrary code execution and allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to compromise the server.

🚩CVE-2020-3243 (CVSSv3 9.8) - exploit this RCE in Cisco UCS Director and prove how an unauthenticated remote attacker can bypass auth and execute arbitrary actions with admin privileges.

🚩CVE-2019-1935 (CVSSv3 9.8) - this RCE in Cisco UCS Director enables an unauthenticated remote attacker to use the SCP User account (scpuser) to log in to the CLI.

🚩CVE-2020-2950 (CVSSv3 9.8) - prove how a remote attacker can fully compromise a server using this RCE in Oracle Business Intelligence.

🚩CVE-2020-3250 (CVSSv3 9.8) - this REST API vulnerability in the Directory Traversal in Cisco UCS Director allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to get sensitive info.

CVE-2019-1935.description: A vulnerability in Cisco Integrated Management Controller (IMC) Supervisor, Cisco UCS Director, and Cisco UCS Director Express for Big Data could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to log in to the CLI of an affected system by using the SCP User account (scpuser), which has default user credentials. The vulnerability is due to the presence of a documented default account with an undocumented default password and incorrect permission settings for that account. Changing the default password for this account is not enforced during the installation of the product. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by using the account to log in to an affected system. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary commands with the privileges of the scpuser account. This includes full read and write access to the system's database.

posts.content:
SonarSource: Government Emails at Risk: Critical Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability in Roundcube Webmail
SonarSource discloses cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Roundcube:

  • CVE-2024-42008 (high?) XSS
  • CVE-2024-42009 (critical?) XSS
  • CVE-2024-42010 unknown

Why you should care about CVE-2024-42008, CVE-2024-42009, CVE-2024-42010:
CISA added a whopping SEVEN RoundCube CVEs to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog, four of them are XSS. As SonarSource noted, "In October 2023, ESET Research reported that a similar vulnerability was actively used by the APT group Winter Vivern to attack European government entities."

#CVE_2024_42008 #CVE_2024_42009 #CVE_2024_42010 #RoundCube #vulnerability #CVE

posts.content:
Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-38206 (8.5 high) Microsoft Copilot Studio Information Disclosure Vulnerability
    An authenticated attacker can bypass Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) protection in Microsoft Copilot Studio to leak sensitive information over a network.
  • CVE-2024-38166 (8.2 high) Microsoft Dynamics 365 Cross-site Scripting Vulnerability
    An unauthenticated attacker can exploit improper neutralization of input during web page generation in Microsoft Dynamics 365 to spoof over a network by tricking a user to click on a link.

The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve

Both vulnerabilities are not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely.

posts.content:
Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
Google does not know how to count past five as they state 5 security fixes but list 6 externally reported vulnerabilities:

  1. CVE-2024-7532 (critical) Out of bounds memory access in ANGLE
  2. CVE-2024-7533 (high) Use after free in Sharing.
  3. CVE-2024-7550 (high) Type Confusion in V8.
  4. CVE-2024-7534 (high) Heap buffer overflow in Layout
  5. CVE-2024-7535 (high): Inappropriate implementation in V8
  6. CVE-2024-7536 (high) Use after free in WebAudio.

No mention of exploitation.

#CVE_2024_7532 #Google #Chrome #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-7535.description: Inappropriate implementation in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 127.0.6533.99 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

posts.content:
JetBrains security advisory: TeamCity 2024.07.1 Bug Fix Is Out
This is one of the few JetBrains blog posts that acknowledges security fixes. The last one is from 27 June 2024. "This bug fix update resolves over 30 issues..." and TeamCity 2024.07.1 Release Notes﻿ states "6 security problems have been fixed." Their Security Bulletin is worthless because it hasn't been updated yet. A quick check of TeamCity in CVE.mitre.org shows 1 new CVE ID for 06 August 2024: CVE-2024-43114 (7.8 high) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.07.1 possible privilege escalation due to incorrect directory permissions. No mention of exploitation in the JetBrains blog post.

#CVE_2024_43114 #JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-43114.description: In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.07.1 possible privilege escalation due to incorrect directory permissions

posts.content:
@da_667 My takeaway is that CVE-2024-38856 is a patch-bypass of CVE-2024-36104, which is a path traversal. I had an issue with SonicWall calling it a zero-day, which implied that it was known to threat actors. No evidence given.

PoC diffing with https://github.com/Mr-xn/CVE-2024-32113

CVE-2024-3211.description: The Shopping Cart & eCommerce Store plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to SQL Injection via the 'productid' attribute of the ec_addtocart shortcode in all versions up to, and including, 5.6.3 due to insufficient escaping on the user supplied parameter and lack of sufficient preparation on the existing SQL query.  This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to append additional SQL queries into already existing queries that can be used to extract sensitive information from the database.

posts.content:
SonicWall: SonicWall Discovers Second Critical Apache OFBiz Zero-Day Vulnerability
Does SonicWall understand what a zero-day is?? They provide no evidence that anyone else knew of this vulnerability prior to the vendor patching. "SonicWall is unaware of any active exploitation."
SonicWall provides a root cause analysis of CVE-2024-38856 (submitter assigned 9.8 critical, disclosed 05 August 2024) Incorrect Authorization vulnerability in Apache OFBiz, which they consider a pre-auth remote code execution. They were able to bypass a patch for CVE-2024-36104 (path traversal). No Proof of Concept exploit provided.

#CVE_2024_38856 #ApacheOFbiz #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-36104.description:
Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal') vulnerability in Apache OFBiz. This issue affects Apache OFBiz: before 18.12.14.

Users are recommended to upgrade to version 18.12.14, which fixes the issue.

posts.content:
ARM security advisory: Mali GPU Driver Vulnerabilities
Normally I don't care about Arm vulnerabilities but since there's been a string of exploited zero-days in the past, I figured I'd keep tabs on it. 2 vulnerabilities: CVE-2024-2937 and CVE-2024-4607 both have the same title (Mali GPU Kernel Driver allows improper GPU memory processing operations), affected products and description. No mention of exploitation.

#CVE_2024_2937 #CVE_2024_4607 #Arm #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-4607.description: Use After Free vulnerability in Arm Ltd Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver, Arm Ltd Valhall GPU Kernel Driver, Arm Ltd Arm 5th Gen GPU Architecture Kernel Driver allows a local non-privileged user to make improper GPU memory processing operations to gain access to already freed memory.This issue affects Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver: from r41p0 through r49p0; Valhall GPU Kernel Driver: from r41p0 through r49p0; Arm 5th Gen GPU Architecture Kernel Driver: from r41p0 through r49p0.

posts.content:
Adobe quietly updated a 09 July 2024 security advisory for Adobe InDesign (APSB24-48), adding two vulnerabilities on 01 August 2024:

  • CVE-2024-39392 (7.8 high) Heap-based Buffer Overflow > Arbitrary code execution
  • CVE-2024-39396 (5.5 medium) Out-of-bounds Read > Memory leak (information disclosure)

No mention of exploitation.

#CVE_2024_39392 #CVE_2024_39396 #Adobe #InDesign #vulnerability #CVE #PatchTuesday

CVE-2024-39396.description: InDesign Desktop versions ID18.5.2, ID19.3 and earlier are affected by an out-of-bounds read vulnerability that could lead to disclosure of sensitive memory. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to bypass mitigations such as ASLR. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

posts.content:
SonarSource: Government Emails at Risk: Critical Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability in Roundcube Webmail
SonarSource discloses cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Roundcube:

  • CVE-2024-42008 (high?) XSS
  • CVE-2024-42009 (critical?) XSS
  • CVE-2024-42010 unknown

Why you should care about CVE-2024-42008, CVE-2024-42009, CVE-2024-42010:
CISA added a whopping SEVEN RoundCube CVEs to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog, four of them are XSS. As SonarSource noted, "In October 2023, ESET Research reported that a similar vulnerability was actively used by the APT group Winter Vivern to attack European government entities."

#CVE_2024_42008 #CVE_2024_42009 #CVE_2024_42010 #RoundCube #vulnerability #CVE
